title: Senior React Native Developer
description:
Location: BGC, Taguig
Employment Type: Contractual (6 months)
Work Arrangement: Hybrid

Job Responsibilities:

  • Develop, test, and deploy high-quality mobile applications for Android and iOS using React Native.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, build, and deliver scalable and performant mobile solutions.
  • Integrate REST and GraphQL APIs for seamless data exchange and backend coordination.
  • Manage CI/CD pipelines using tools such as Fastlane, CodePush, and OTA updates for efficient release cycles.
  • Utilize cloud services like Firebase, AWS (Amplify, S3, Lambda), and GCP (Firebase suite) to enhance app functionality and scalability.
  • Implement robust state management with Redux or Zustand and ensure responsive UI/UX design across devices.
  • Apply automated testing frameworks (e.g., Detox, Jest) to maintain high code quality and reliability.
  • Collaborate with backend teams using Node.js or Python for full-stack integration.
  • Participate in Agile/Scrum ceremonies and contribute to continuous improvement of development practices.
  • Provide production support and troubleshoot issues in live environments as needed.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
  • 5+ years of software development experience, including 4+ years in React Native for cross-platform app delivery.
  • Proven experience deploying apps to Google Play and Apple App Store.
  • Strong proficiency in React Native, TypeScript, JavaScript, Redux/Zustand, React Navigation, and API integration.
  • Hands-on experience with CI/CD, Fastlane, CodePush, and OTA updates.
  • Knowledgeable in Docker, Kubernetes, and cloud deployment on AWS/GCP.
  • Familiar with Expo, Firebase, and mobile app analytics tools.
  • Strong understanding of mobile architecture, UX principles, and lifecycle management.
  • Excellent collaboration, problem-solving, and communication skills.
  • Experience working in Agile/Scrum teams.

Apply now and be part of a dynamic team!

Job Type: Fixed term
Contract length: 6 months

Pay: Php120,000.00 - Php150,000.00 per month

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Opportunities for promotion

Work Location: In person

title: IT Supervisor (Software Developer)
description:
Job Description

  • Analyzes existing computer systems and makes recommendations for upgrades and improvements.
  • Develops and oversees the installation of software and hardware systems.
  • Performs tests and troubleshooting as well as quality assurance.
  • Develops software user manuals, and IT policies, procedures, and protocols.
  • Collaborates with other departments and professionals in developing hospitals’ systems.
  • Ensuring all installations, maintenance and upgrades are carried out on schedule and client specifications
  • Writing code and implementing computer programs aligned with the business needs using programming languages.
  • Prepares proper documentation of programs ensuring all the details of development, revisions, and alterations are included.
  • Collaborates with outside software providers in the creation and maintenance of hospital systems and software.
  • Conducts troubleshooting of system malfunctions and does necessary actions to resolve them.
  • Performs other duties and responsibilities that may be delegated by the Department Head, Hospital Administrator, and other Hospital Officials from time to time.

Qualifications

  • Candidate must possess at least Bachelor's/College Degree in Information Technology
  • Preferably with 2 years of working experience in the related field is required for this position.
  • Excellent interpersonal and leadership skills.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

  • Company Christmas gift
  • Company events
  • Health insurance
  • Opportunities for promotion
  • Paid training
  • Staff meals provided

title: Software Implementation Engineer (Hybrid)
description:
At Broadridge, we've built a culture where the highest goal is to empower others to accomplish more. If you’re passionate about developing your career, while helping others along the way, come join the Broadridge team.
Role Overview
We are seeking a dynamic Software Implementation Engineer to join our team dedicated to managing a variety of new and ongoing client requests. This role involves deploying environments for new clients, upgrading applications for existing ones, designing and developing client solutions per client requests as well as providing Level 2 support.
The successful candidate will play a crucial role in developing architectural and technical designs tailored to client-specific requirements and will lead their implementation through coding on client-specific code layers.
Responsibilities
  • Deploying environments for new clients
  • Upgrading applications for existing clients
  • Effort estimates
  • Development of architectural and technical design for new client-specific requirements
  • Implementation of client-specific requirements, including coding on client-specific code layer
  • L2 support
Your Profile
  • Experience with complex software products implementation or development (product companies preferably)
  • T-SQL fluent enough to develop complex queries/procedures/views, and read and understand existing code
  • Solid programming skills (C#, VB, PowerShell) including understanding of basic concepts, ability to construct algorithms
  • Basic understanding of Windows and Linux OS architecture
  • Networking basics
  • Solid Financial industry knowledge
  • Strong Business Analysis skills
  • Ability to learn fast
  • Pro-activity
  • Good communication skills – we have team distributed internationally
#LI-KA2 #LI-Hybrid
We are dedicated to fostering a collaborative, engaging, and inclusive environment and are committed to providing a workplace that empowers associates to be authentic and bring their best to work. We believe that associates do their best when they feel safe, understood, and valued, and we work diligently and collaboratively to ensure Broadridge is a company—and ultimately a community—that recognizes and celebrates everyone’s unique perspective.
Use of AI in Hiring
As part of the recruiting process, Broadridge may use technology, including artificial intelligence (AI)-based tools, to help review and evaluate applications. These tools are used only to support our recruiters and hiring managers, and all employment decisions include human review to ensure fairness, accuracy, and compliance with applicable laws. Please note that honesty and transparency are critical to our hiring process. Any attempt to falsify, misrepresent, or disguise information in an application, resume, assessment, or interview will result in disqualification from consideration.
companyDescription: Broadridge is a global Fintech leader, delivering technology-driven solutions that drive digital transformation for banks, broker-dealers, asset and wealth managers and public companies.

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description:
Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) is an engineering discipline that integrates software and systems engineering to design, build, and operate production systems. The SRE team ensures that the company’s services—both internal and client-facing—maintain high reliability, availability, and performance. They continuously improve system efficiency and scalability while keeping a close watch on capacity, uptime, and overall user experience.

Key Responsibilities

  • Contribute to the full service lifecycle — from design and setup to deployment, monitoring, and continuous improvement.
  • Build, configure, and maintain servers, systems, and related infrastructure according to project requirements.
  • Monitor system health daily to ensure reliability and performance, reviewing logs, verifying backups, and addressing issues promptly.
  • Conduct regular security checks to identify and prevent potential risks or intrusions.
  • Recommend new tools and technologies to strengthen security and improve efficiency.
  • Assist with system migrations, upgrades, and automation initiatives.
  • Participate in incident response and post-incident reviews to enhance system reliability.
  • Perform regular tuning, patching, and updates to keep systems secure and optimized.
  • Maintain clear documentation for setup, configuration, and maintenance processes.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
  • Hands-on experience managing and troubleshooting POSIX-based operating systems such as CentOS, Ubuntu, or macOS.
  • Strong expertise in at least one server-grade Linux distribution (e.g., CentOS or Ubuntu).
  • Solid understanding of database management, SQL queries, and performance optimization (MySQL/MariaDB).
  • Proficient in scripting with tools like Bash, Python, or Perl; knowledge of languages such as PHP, C, C++, or Java is an advantage.
  • Experienced in setting up, configuring, and managing WordPress environments.
  • Familiar with system monitoring and analytics tools (e.g., Sysdig, Papertrail, Nagios, Cacti, Splunk).
  • Knowledgeable in security best practices including SSL/TLS, SFTP, password management, and firewall configurations.
  • Basic experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Google Cloud, or Rackspace.
  • RHCSA/RHCE or an equivalent certification is required.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Pay: Php100,000.00 - Php150,000.00 per month

Work Location: Remote

title: Systems Developer(Oracle Cloud)
description:
Work Schedule

Other

Environmental Conditions

Office

Job Description

Provides systems analysis, design, development, testing and support for moderately complex technical information system components.

Essential Functions:

  • Designs and develops components and services according to specifications within a team environment.
  • Performs systems analysis and prepares detailed system documentation including requirements, specifications, test plans and user manuals.
  • Performs unit and system tests and as needed, validation testing.
  • Coordinates with Operations staff on deployment of applications.
  • Works with business partners to analyse and address support requests to include training.
  • Ensures all activities are performed with quality and compliance.

Qualifications

Education and Experience:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent and relevant formal academic / vocational qualification.

Previous experience that provides the knowledge, skills, and abilities to perform the job (comparable to 2+ years’) or equivalent combination of education, training, & experience.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Good experience writing optimized Oracle SQL queries in a manner that adheres to Oracle recommendations.
  • -> Minimum 2 years experience
  • Strong communication skill with experience interacting directly with coworkers and process owners.
    • Proficient understanding Oracle Cloud ERP data sets.
  • -> Minimum 2 years experience
    • Ability to create user-friendly BIP/OTBI report objects: Data Models, Reports, and Templates.
  • -> Minimum 2 years experience
  • Experience with Web Services and API tools and functionality.
  • Good Understanding of Oracle Cloud ERP techniques exporting data NOT using OIC (Oracle Integration Cloud).
  • Experienced in creating and troubleshooting report templates.
  • Able to effectively utilize Data Model Bursting techniques.
  • Knowledge and understanding of ESS Scheduled jobs.
  • Knowledge and experience interacting with Common Lookups and Value sets.
  • Experience navigating front-end Oracle Cloud ERP functionality.
  • Able to document developed objects end-to-end (Design document).
  • Ability to create thorough test scripts.
  • Knowledge using Oracle Business Intelligence Cloud Connector (BICC) is a bonus.
  • FBDI knowledge and usage is a bonus.
  • Experience with Non-Oracle Middleware technology is a bonus.
  • Must be willing to work from 1 PM IST to 10 PM IST [Manila - 3:30 PM PST to 12:30 AM PST]

title: Product Engineering, Lead Specialist
description:
Join us on a journey of endless possibilities

At Strada , possibility isn’t just a promise – it’s the foundation of everything we do. We believe in unlocking potential for every colleague, creating a journey of growth, discovery, and impact.

With the support, resources, and opportunities we provide, you’ll build a fulfilling future – working on meaningful projects that span industries and regions, contributing to outcomes that matter.

Learn more at www.stradaglobal.com


Product Engineering, Lead Specialist (Back-end .NET Developer)

Job Responsibilities:
A development team member of an Agile team you participate in and contribute to all Agile ceremonies such as and not limited to:

  • Daily stand-up meeting, you provide overview of your tasks you performed last working day, you explain what tasks you will be picking up and explain any impediment that blocks you from delivering your planned tasks. You also support the team and help solving impediments raised by other team members where applicable.

  • Sprint planning: You help providing estimations and suggest what stories/tasks you can pick up and deliver in the upcoming sprint.

  • Sprint Review and Demo: you keep all tasks and story stories up to date and prepare demonstrations of working software

  • Sprint retrospective: you provide insights on what went well and what can be improved in next sprints to increase the team velocity

  • Refinement sessions: in a working session with stakeholders, you make sure you have a full understanding of the functional (and non-functional) requirements and are able to provide technical solution designs and accurate estimates.

As a developer in general:

  • You write performant and qualitative stable and maintainable code respecting design patterns like SOLID and DRY.

  • You are responsible to manage your code changes correctly within planned releases and respecting the SDLC and compliance requirements.

  • All your code is well documented in our technical Wiki and release notes and deployment instructions are always complete and timely delivered as part of our DOD together with a demo of working software.

  • You collaborate with your team members and think as one team.


Requirements:

Skills and Experience

  • Minimum 5 years of experience of C#.

  • Bachelor's degree holder of Computer Science, Information Technology or any related course/degree.

  • Very good coding and unit testing capabilities (C#, LINQ, SQL).

  • Very good knowledge of .NET Frameworks (i.e. Entity framework).

  • Experienced with Databases (MySQL, Oracle, Azure sql Server, Mongo DB, Cosmos DB).

  • Willingness and ability to work independently as part of the global virtual team.

  • Analytical skills and ability to create a quality documentation.

  • Experience with Microsoft Azure is an asset.

  • Experienced in writing/understanding/challenging Technical Designs.

  • Experienced in development best practices like: SOLID (Single Responsibility Principle, Open/Closed Principle, Liskov, Substitution Principle, Interface Segregation Principle, Dependency Inversion), DRY (Don’t Repeat Yourself), Security First, and TDD (Test Driven Development).

  • Having notions of git.

  • Experience working with Azure DevOps or similar (Jira).

  • Being an excellent Team Player collaborating with frontend developers.

At Strada, our values guide everything we do:

  • Anticipate Customer Needs – We stay ahead of trends so our customers can grow and succeed.

  • Own the Outcome – We take responsibility for delivering excellence and ensuring things get done right.

  • Challenge Ourselves to Work Smarter – We move faster than the world around us to drive change and accomplish more.

  • Empower Each Other to Solve Problems – We tackle challenges head on, ask tough questions, and collaborate to find the best solutions.

  • Care About Our Work – We understand that what we do impacts millions, and we have a responsibility to get it right.

Benefits

At Strada, we support your whole self—offering a range of benefits for your health, wellbeing, finances, and future. These include health coverage, wellbeing programs, paid leave (vacation, sick, parental), retirement plans, learning opportunities, and more.

All offers are contingent on successful completion of background checks, where permitted by law and as appropriate for the role. These may include identity, education, employment, and in some cases, criminal history verification, checks against global watchlists, credit reports, and/or drug testing. You’ll be informed of the specific checks applicable to your role and location during the recruitment process.

Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Strada is dedicated to fostering a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and supported. We believe that embracing differences strengthens our teams and drives innovation and success.

Diversity Policy Statement

Strada is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination based on legally protected characteristics. We provide reasonable accommodations for disabilities and religious practices. Applicants may request reasonable accommodation by contacting their recruiter.

Authorization to work in the Employing Country

To be considered, you must have current and future work authorization in the country where you're applying, without the need for visa sponsorship by Strada.

Please note: This job description does not limit Strada’s right to assign or reassign responsibilities, including to subsidiaries, partners, or future business purchasers.

We offer you a competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.

DISCLAIMER:


Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities of this job to other entities; including but not limited to subsidiaries, partners, or purchasers of Strada business units.

title: Frontend Software Developer (PH) - WYSIWYG, Editor and Authoring Tools
description:
Department: Editor
Track: Individual Contributor
Reports to: Editor Manager
Direct Reports: N/A

Location: Hybrid (Manila)
Schedule: Full-time, permanent | Mon-Fri, 9:00-6:00pm (PHT)
Compensation: Competitive, based on experience
Start Date: Flexible â€” weâ€™d love you to join soon

About Us

Avvoka is a fast-growing legal technology scale-up specialising in document automation. Our platform empowers legal, commercial, and operations teams to draft, negotiate, and manage contracts more efficiently - reducing friction, improving compliance, and accelerating deal cycles.

Weâ€™re trusted by leading global organisations, from Magic Circle law firms to major financial institutions and international franchises. Our technology has supported everything from billion-pound transactions to cross-border partnership agreements.

Avvoka is in an exciting growth phase - evolving from a bootstrapped start-up to a scale-up, with 60% growth in headcount and over 70% organic revenue growth in the past year.

Who You Are

Weâ€™re hiring a technically strong Frontend Software Developer to own and evolve our in-browser WYSIWYG editor and authoring tools. This is a hands-on role focused on performance, correctness and delightful UX for complex legal documents â€” including real-time collaborative features. You will design and implement editor features, optimise rendering and latency, and work closely with product, design and legal engineers to ship robust, user-facing experiences.

A great candidate might be someone who has:
  • Worked on the UI/UX or core implementation of text/document editors (e.g., features for Microsoft Word, Google Docs, Notion, Coda, or enterprise authoring tools).
  • Built or contributed to collaborative editors (real-time multiplayer editors) where low latency, concurrency and presence/awareness UX were central.
  • Deep experience extending or authoring editor modules/plugins (for example, custom modules in Quill, ProseMirror plugins, or Slate tools).
Key Responsibilities

1\. Contribute to and evolve the Editor

  • Lead feature and architecture work for the in-browser document editor and authoring surfaces.
  • Build high-performance, low-latency features that handle complex data models, dynamic content and large documents.
  • Implement, extend and maintain Quill modules and integrate with Quillâ€™s event API.
2\. Write and maintain robust, testable code

  • Deliver clean, maintainable TypeScript/JavaScript with strong type safety and automated tests.
  • Use modern frameworks and tools to improve performance, stability, and developer ergonomics.
  • Ensure cross-browser compatibility and responsive behaviour across devices.
3\. Real-time collaboration & correctness

  • Implement collaboration features (presence, cursors, comments) with a focus on consistency and minimal latency.
  • Work with backend engineers on OT/CRDT integration, conflict resolution, and data reconciliation strategies.
4\. Collaborate and influence product & UX

  • Partner with designers, product managers and legal engineers to translate UX needs into technical solutions.
  • Provide constructive code reviews and take part in design and architecture discussions focusing on usability, accessibility and performance.
5\. Improve developer experience & operational quality

  • Improve internal tools, build reliable CI/CD for frontend releases, and ship observability for editor performance.
  • Document editor APIs and onboarding flows for other engineers and product teams
Key Measures of Success

To ensure your application has the best opportunity of success, your CV could cover the below measures of success with quantifiable results (e.g. percentages, growth, reductions, impact)

  • Reduced editor load times, rendering bottlenecks or collaboration latency by measurable margins.
  • Delivered user-visible features that improved authoring efficiency (e.g., reduced average task time, fewer formatting errors).
  • Consistently high code quality with minimal production regressions.
  • Demonstrable improvements to editor architecture that increase maintainability and scale.
Person Specification

The ideal candidate would have:
  • Strong proficiency in JavaScript and TypeScript ( 5+ years of professional experience).
  • Hands-on experience building/maintaining complex web apps â€” ideally editor/authoring tools or design surfaces.
  • Practical experience with Quillâ€™s module system and Quillâ€™s event API (essential).
  • Deep understanding of browser rendering, virtualisation techniques, memory management and performance optimisation.
  • Prior experience with real-time collaboration features (OT/CRDT, WebSockets, presence).
  • Solid testing strategies and experience with performance monitoring in production.
The desirable candidate would have:
  • Experience with Slate.js, ProseMirror or other rich-text frameworks.
  • Familiarity with legal tech, document automation, or enterprise B2B SaaS.
  • Experience scaling frontend architecture at a fast-growing startup or scale-up.
  • Exposure to functional programming (ClojureScript or FP patterns).
In addition to the technical and professional skills, there are certain core attributes we value across all roles:

  • Adaptability in dynamically evolving settings
  • A proactive, solution-focused mindset with ownership
  • A collaborative spirit, supporting and mentoring others
If youâ€™re excited about this role but your experience doesnâ€™t align perfectly with every qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway â€” you might be just the candidate weâ€™re looking for.

Our Hiring Process

  • CV Review: Our People team reviews all applications carefully.
  • Screening Call (15m): A quick virtual chat with our People team to learn more about you and answer any initial questions.
  • Stage 1 â€“ Assessment Interview (30â€“45m): A virtual assessment interview with the Hiring Manager focused on your experience and approach.
  • Stage 2 â€“ Senior Interview (for senior roles): An additional conversation with members of the leadership team.
  • Meet the Team: Where possible, weâ€™ll invite shortlisted candidates to visit our WeWork Waterloo office to meet the wider team.
We aim to make an offer to the successful candidate within a month of application, but this will vary by role and seniority.

Why Join Us

At Avvoka, youâ€™ll join a considerate, innovative, and inclusive team where every voice matters. Youâ€™ll be instrumental in shaping our expansion into financial services - helping major institutions modernise how they handle legal and commercial documentation - while advancing your own career in enterprise SaaS sales.

Benefits

  • Remote First hybrid working - Choose your days in office based on operational requirements
  • Annual learning and development budget
  • Home office IT allowance
  • 25 daysâ€™ annual leave plus public holidays
  • Right to request flexible working arrangements
  • A collaborative, transparent company culture with real opportunities for growth
Equal Opportunities

We are an equal opportunity employer that celebrates diversity and inclusion. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, identities, and experiences - including those from underrepresented groups - and are happy to provide reasonable adjustments for candidates with disabilities during the recruitment process.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer (Application Operations) - START ASAP - Manila - Day Shift - Onsite
description:
Overview:

We’re looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer to take ownership of the end-to-end software delivery process, from build and deployment to automation and release management. This role focuses on application operations rather than infrastructure — ensuring that mobile, web, and backend systems built with React Native, Angular, and Python run efficiently through well-designed CI/CD pipelines, automation, and operational monitoring.

As a senior resource, you’ll also mentor junior engineers, enhance deployment architecture, and drive DevOps best practices across the team.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead the design, implementation, and optimization of CI/CD pipelines using Azure DevOps for all application environments.
  • Automate build, test, and deployment workflows using Ansible, Python, and other DevOps tools.
  • Oversee operational stability and performance for React Native, Angular, and Python 3-based applications.
  • Manage version control strategies, branching models, and release processes across development teams.
  • Collaborate closely with developers and QA to ensure smooth, reliable, and traceable deployments.
  • Conduct code and pipeline reviews, ensuring compliance with DevOps and security best practices.
  • Design and maintain monitoring, alerting, and incident response processes for application releases.
  • Maintain and continuously improve build scripts, deployment configurations, and environment setup documentation.
  • Mentor junior DevOps and software engineers in CI/CD, automation, and release management.
  • Proactively identify opportunities to enhance efficiency, scalability, and deployment reliability.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
  • 4–6 years of experience in DevOps, application delivery, or software operations, with proven CI/CD management experience.
  • Expertise in Azure DevOps Pipelines and automation scripting (Python, YAML, Ansible).
  • Strong knowledge of Python 3 development, Microsoft SQL Server, and integration workflows.
  • Familiarity with React Native and Angular 17+ applications from a build/release standpoint.
  • In-depth understanding of software delivery lifecycle, agile development, and Scrum methodologies.
  • Excellent problem-solving, communication, and leadership skills.
  • Ability to manage multiple releases and environments efficiently under tight timelines.

Preferred Skills:

title: Webmaster & Web Designer
description:
MOVE Your Business is proud to represent Geraci LLP, an American-based law firm focused exclusively on representing private lenders. Geraci LLP provides comprehensive legal services to private lenders throughout the United States, including customized loan documentation, regulatory compliance, and risk mitigation. Their mission is to support private lending professionals with practical, forward-thinking legal solutions that enable confident decision-making and sustained growth.

On behalf of Geraci LLP, we are seeking a talented and reliable Webmaster & Web Designer to manage, maintain, and enhance multiple websites for our law firm. This role requires a strong blend of technical expertise and creative design skills, ensuring all sites remain visually compelling, user-friendly, secure, and compliant with California privacy regulations.

The ideal candidate is equally comfortable troubleshooting backend issues as they are designing modern, engaging web layouts that reflect our firm’s professionalism and brand identity.

NOTE: We kindly ask that you submit your resume in English to help us understand your qualifications better. Looking forward to reviewing your application.

Benefits:

  • Competitive salary ($1,200/month)
  • Strong support system
  • Salary increase starting in your first year of employment (based on performance)
  • Health benefit ($30/month)
  • Training materials for upskilling provided
  • Paid holiday leaves (depending on the holidays that the client observes)
  • Paid sick leaves (sick leave convertible to cash if perfect attendance)
  • Paid planned leaves
  • Internet Allowance ($25/month)

Key Responsibilities

Website Management & Maintenance:

  • Oversee and maintain multiple websites across different domains.
  • Ensure all sites are secure, optimized for speed, and performing reliably.
  • Conduct regular site audits to identify and resolve technical issues, broken links, or outdated content.
  • Manage hosting environments, backups, and SSL certificates.

Design & Development:

  • Design visually appealing, mobile-responsive layouts aligned with brand standards.
  • Build and update pages using WordPress and Elementor with strong attention to detail and user experience.
  • Create new landing pages, microsites, and campaign pages as needed.
  • Ensure consistency of style, tone, and quality across all firm websites.

Plugin System Updates:

  • Regularly update all plugins, themes, and CMS systems.
  • Test compatibility and functionality before deployment.
  • Implement technical SEO best practices and performance optimizations.

Compliance & Security:

  • Ensure all websites adhere to the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) and California Privacy Rights Act (CPRA).
  • Maintain proper cookie consent, privacy notices, and data handling practices.
  • Collaborate with internal teams to meet compliance and accessibility (ADA) standards.

Analytics & Reporting:

  • Track website traffic, performance, and engagement using Google Analytics (GA4) and Search Console.
  • Provide regular reports and actionable recommendations for improvement.

Qualifications:

  • Experience: 3+ years in a webmaster, web design, or front-end development role (law firm or professional services experience preferred).

Technical Expertise:

  • Advanced proficiency in WordPress and Elementor (required).

Design Skills:

  • Proven ability to design clean, modern, and professional web layouts.
  • Proficiency with design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite, Canva, or Figma.
  • Strong visual sense and an eye for brand consistency.

Compliance Knowledge:

  • Working understanding of CCPA, CPRA, and online privacy regulations.

Soft Skills:

  • Highly organized, detail-oriented, and self-motivated.
  • Able to manage multiple projects, prioritize deadlines, and communicate effectively.

Preferred Experience

  • Managing multiple websites or domains for a single organization.
  • Experience working with law firms, financial services, or other regulated industries.
  • Familiarity with ADA accessibility standards and compliance testing.

About Us: MOVE Your Business is an outsourcing company based in Southern California, dedicated to empowering both businesses and professionals. We connect growing companies with skilled virtual talent while creating meaningful, long-term opportunities for our team members. Sr. Analyst Programmer - Fullstack Developer
description:
Qualifications

  • 5+ years of professional experience with Microsoft .NET (Core/Framework), building scalable and maintainable applications.
  • 4+ years of experience in SQL Server with expertise in writing complex queries, stored procedures, and performance tuning.
  • Strong front-end experience with HTML, CSS, JavaScript (ES6+), and React.js (2+ year), including modern state management and component-based design.
  • 1+ year of experience with TypeScript for building strongly typed and maintainable React applications.
  • 2+ years of experience in using Git for version control, branching strategies, and collaborative development.
  • Hands-on Agile experience (1+ year), working with cross-functional teams in sprint-based delivery.
  • Solid experience/understanding of software development best practices: testing strategies (unit/integration), version control, code review, and clean code principles
  • Strong knowledge/experience of web fundamentals (HTTP, REST APIs, response codes, and API integration).
  • Deep understanding/experience of .NET best practices, including SOLID principles, dependency injection, and unit testing frameworks.
  • Excellent English communication skills – able to collaborate effectively, explain complex technical details clearly, and produce well-structured documentation.
  • Adaptable and growth-oriented, eager to learn and apply new tools, patterns, and emerging technologies.
  • Keeps up-to-date with industry trends and modern software development practices.

Job Description

JOB DESCRIPTION:

For 170 years the Essilor Group has served the public by creating the standard of quality in ophthalmic lenses. More recently, through Essilor's ecosystem of web properties, we also serve hundreds of millions of digital consumers globally each year. As a full stack developer on Essilor's Digital Acceleration (HELIX) team, you will work within a team environment to deliver full stack solutions that execute HELIX priorities and initiatives. Primary responsibilities include the design, development and integration of software components using Microsoft .NET Framework, SQL Server, and JavaScript (React). If you are versatile and enjoy working on both front and back-end software equally, this is a great opportunity.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable .Net code
  • Developing, implementing, and optimizing SQL queries
  • Work with Dallas HELIX and other ESSPI HELIX resources on an agile team.

  • Update user stories and tasks in JIRA to reflect the status of sprint.
  • Check work for defects prior to releasing to QA.
  • Submit pull requests, handle code merges, and facilitate software releases.
  • Troubleshoot and own defects identified by the QA team and customers.
  • Nurture a culture of team excellence with openness, transparency, close collaboration, and a willingness to learn.
  • Proactively provides updates to the customer on the progress of the initiative.
  • Maintains and updates daily monitoring of service deliverables;
  • Prepares and submits of needed reports;
  • Ensure continuity of providing service by flexibly adjusting to help other team members.
  • Expand knowledge on business process and IT related information;

  • Extends help or conducts training to Analyst/Programmers in giving technical expertise or know-how to other team members.
  • Performance of other tasks as may be assigned

title: AI Full-Stack Engineer
description:
Role Summary

We’re looking for an experienced AI Pod Engineer to join our high-performing development team at Adaca. This role blends full-stack engineering expertise with a strong understanding of AI integration and scalable application design.

You’ll build and deploy modern web applications using Next.js, React, and TypeScript, while integrating AI models and APIs (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google Vertex, etc.) to enhance functionality and user experience.

The ideal candidate has hands-on experience delivering production-grade systems, thrives in collaborative product teams, and is eager to explore the frontier of AI-assisted development using tools like Cursor and Claude Code.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and maintain AI-powered web applications using Next.js, React, and TypeScript.
  • Integrate AI models and APIs (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google Vertex, Azure OpenAI, Amazon Bedrock, etc.) into production systems.
  • Build scalable RESTful APIs and modular backend services using Node.js and Supabase (or PostgreSQL).
  • Leverage AI-enabled IDEs and development tools (e.g., Cursor, Claude Code) to accelerate coding and maintain high quality.
  • Collaborate closely with AI, product, and design teams to translate business goals into robust technical solutions.
  • Ensure best practices for performance, scalability, maintainability, and security across the stack.
  • Deploy and maintain applications on AWS, Azure, or Cloudflare, including CI/CD pipelines, Docker/Kubernetes, and monitoring.
  • Stay current with emerging technologies in web development and AI to continuously improve Adaca’s AI product capabilities.

Tech Stack

Essential:

  • React
  • Next.js
  • TypeScript
  • PostgreSQL / Supabase
  • AI Integration (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google Vertex, etc.)

Nice to Have:

  • Cloudflare (Workers, Pages, or Durable Objects)
  • AI Tooling (Cursor, Claude Code, Copilot, etc.)
  • Node.js / Express / NestJS
  • AWS / Azure cloud deployment experience

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).
  • 7+ years of full-stack development experience with strong proficiency in:
  • React / Next.js (frontend frameworks, state management, UI optimization)
  • Node.js, TypeScript (backend and API development)
  • PostgreSQL / Supabase (database design and optimization)
  • Experience integrating AI models and APIs in production environments.
  • Solid understanding of software architecture, cloud services, and DevOps practices (CI/CD, Docker, Kubernetes).
  • Familiarity with testing frameworks (Jest, Cypress) and Git-based version control.
  • Strong collaboration, communication, and problem-solving skills.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

  • Work from home

Work Location: Remote

title: Senior .Net Developer
description:
About Sharesource:

We are a BCorp company whose purpose is to democratise opportunities for individuals from developing countries. With our brand and culture empowering our partners to attract and keep the most qualified members, we share the knowledge to unleash potential and grow scaling teams for Australian and Canadian businesses.

https://www.sharesource.com.au/

Join a trailblazing Sydney tech venture as a .NET Developer and help build the backbone of next-gen automation and intelligent business systems!

We're searching for a skilled Senior .NET Developer who thrives on innovation, autonomy, and building high-impact solutions. This is an opportunity to join a fast-growing Sydney-based venture that's transforming small business operations through automation, AI, and custom software development.

As one of the foundational members of our development team, you'll play a key role in shaping the architecture, coding standards, and delivery of solutions that drive real results across industries—from logistics to finance. If you're excited about building scalable systems, working with modern tech stacks, and contributing to a venture that's just three months young but already making waves, this is your chance to make a lasting impact.


What are you expected to do?

  • AWS Cloud Architecture & Infrastructure:
    • Design, deploy, and maintain scalable cloud solutions on AWS.
    • Implement and manage CI/CD pipelines for efficient development and deployment workflows.
    • Ensure robust security measures, compliance, and disaster recovery plans are in place.
  • Product Development & Delivery:
    • Oversee the software development lifecycle, from ideation to deployment and support.
    • Collaborate with Product, UX/UI, and other teams to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
    • Conduct code reviews, system testing, and quality assurance to maintain high standards.
  • Team Collaboration & Mentorship:
    • Mentor and support engineers, fostering a culture of collaboration and continuous learning.
    • Facilitate effective communication within the technical team and with other departments to ensure seamless collaboration.
  • Operational Efficiency & Cost Optimisation:
    • Optimise AWS infrastructure costs while ensuring high availability and performance.
    • Monitor and maintain system health, performance, and security through the use of proactive monitoring tools

You'll be a great fit if:

  • You hold a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field.
  • You have 5+ years of experience developing applications using .NET and .NET Core, with a solid understanding of modern software architecture.
  • You have hands-on experience working with AWS, including deploying and maintaining scalable, secure applications in the cloud.
  • You're confident in setting up and managing CI/CD pipelines to streamline build, test, and deployment workflows.
  • You take pride in writing clean, maintainable, and efficient code—and always look for ways to improve performance and reliability.
  • You have a good eye for system optimization, cost efficiency, and proactive monitoring in a production environment.
  • You're comfortable collaborating with cross-functional teams (Product, Design, QA) and can translate technical concepts into clear business solutions.
  • You enjoy mentoring and supporting peers while fostering a culture of learning and continuous improvement.
  • You're a self-starter who thrives in dynamic, fast-paced environments and takes ownership of your work from concept to delivery.

What you gain beyond the role:

  • Remote + Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy the best of both worlds—collaborative office days when it counts, balanced with the freedom to work from home.
  • Achieve Work-Life Balance and Flexibility: Work in an environment where you're trusted and empowered to work independently, while still having the support you need to deliver your best. Here, flexibility isn't just a perk—it's how we help you perform at your best, without sacrificing life outside of work.
  • Open Culture: Your voice matters, we encourage proactive communication and fresh ideas.
  • Supportive Team: From your very first day to every career milestone, we've got your back—with long-term growth and projects you can truly thrive in.
  • Learn and Grow: Training, coaching, and international opportunities to level up your skills and career
  • Be part of a B-Corp company that puts people and planet first while creating meaningful impact.

Please note: This role is remote; however, we require candidates to be based locally in the Philippines. This is to support occasional onsite activities such as team events, client meetings, or equipment handover. Additionally, local residency is necessary for compliance with Philippines labor laws and employment regulations.

___________________

Why work for Sharesource?

Our clients come from all walks of life and so do we. We hire hundreds of skillful individuals from a wide variety of backgrounds, genders, ages, and personalities to live out our diverse culture and make a positive impact on the world!

Our 5 Values:

  • Make a social impact: We balance our work for client teams and for society by constantly making a positive impact.
  • Be proactive: We encourage brave thinking and continuous improvement, and drive change through action.
  • Create value: We create measurable values for our stakeholders: our teams, partners, suppliers, investors, and communities.
  • Be fair, open and honest: We foster equality and inclusivity in a supportive environment that embraces diversity and celebrates achievements.
  • Add fun, passion and love: We prioritise fun and passion, fostering higher engagement and a positive can-do attitude.

___________________
What to Expect in the Process?

  • You'll go through 3–4 interviews plus a possible assessment with our client partner. This includes an initial chat, a culture-fit interview, and 1–2 conversations with our awesome client. The whole process usually takes 1–2 weeks, but we'll let you know if things need to move quicker.
  • Our best advice? Be yourself and enjoy the conversations. We'll keep you updated every step of the way, and you're always welcome to reach out for updates anytime.
  • If all goes well, we'll complete reference checks and requirements quickly—so we can get that job offer to you without delay.

We would be grateful if you have these already:

  • Fit to Work/Health Card (Basic 5 employment medical tests)
  • NBI Clearance
  • Social IDs - PHIC, SSS, HDMF, TIN
  • Character references with contact info

At Sharesource, we believe in the value of diversity and inclusion. We are committed to creating a diverse, respectful, and inclusive workplace, and we do not discriminate based on factors such as race, gender, religion, sexual orientation, or disability.

title: Cloud Operations Engineer
description:
Role Details

Location: Hybrid - Manila
Work Arrangement: 10am - 6pm US Mountain Time and some weekends


About Us

Crescendo represents peak CX performance in the AI era. We combine world-class outsourcing expertise with innovative technology to set a new standard in CX and operations, delivering results that scale and support that never sleeps.

More than that, Crescendo is about people. We don’t just connect talent with opportunity—we create a place where careers grow, ideas thrive, and people are empowered to make an impact.

Join us at Crescendo, and let’s build the future of customer experience together.


The Role

We are seeking a talented Cloud Operations Engineer to join our team.

The Cloud Operations Engineer role is an individual contributor who is responsible for the planning, rollout, maintenance, inter-connectivity and troubleshooting of Crescendo’s cloud platforms (such as Google Workspace, Slack, Jira, and others).

This is a technical role designed to include both collaborative business analysis with associates throughout the company and back end technical work independently of, and in collaboration with, the IT, Security, and Engineering teams.

What You’ll Do:

  • Effectively communicate complex concepts with vendors, customers, co-workers and management, both verbally and in writing.
  • Engage with business partners to analyze opportunities and implement innovative process and technology solutions
  • Evaluate, implement, and support reference integration architectures between platform systems
  • Perform advanced administration and troubleshooting of Crescendo platform systems.
  • Own the change management and configuration/maintenance processes for specific Crescendo network and cloud platforms.
  • Strategize with the global IT manager on new platform/app initiatives, feature rollouts, and potential integrations between platforms.
  • Collaborate with the information security team to ensure that platforms are secure and meet Crescendo standards.
  • Monitor platforms and address availability and security issues as they arise.
  • Assist the information security team in performing regular access audits and performs role & license changes as appropriate within each platform.
  • Maintain documentation in Crescendo’s Confluence wiki on platform management best practices, admin guides and troubleshooting guides.
  • Train IT and security staff on platform administration best practices and standard procedures

What We Expect From You:

  • 3-5 years experience in business analysis techniques and business process engineering
  • Some knowledge/experience with modern scripting languages
  • Good knowledge administering and configuring enterprise productivity or line of business platforms
  • Knowledge of modern SaaS platforms and cross-platform integrations
  • SDLC knowledge
  • Knowledge of and experience applying structured IT change management procedures
  • Strong business acumen and communication skills
Desirable (not required) technical knowledge:
  • Configuration/Management of SaaS platforms such as Google Workspace, Slack, Jira
  • Experience working with SSO and identity providers
  • Experience administering cloud platforms such as GCP, AWS

Why Crescendo?

  • We’re building a new category: Augmented AI
  • We’re moving at record-breaking speed: 0 to $100M+ ARR in under a year
  • We only win when our customers win—outcomes over hype, every time
  • You’ll be part of a high-performing, purpose-driven team obsessed with speed, creativity, and craft
  • This is your chance to help define the DNA of Crescendo’s sales culture. If you’re ready to learn fast, build fast, and grow fast—let’s talk.

Company Culture Is At Our Core

Core values give our work intention and our culture its edge. They’re the standards we hold for ourselves, our partners, and each other.

  • Care for others: Empathy is a key driver. When people thrive, so does the mission.
  • Embrace growth: Curiosity fuels progress. Take bold risks, sharpen your edge, go forward.
  • Manifest trust: Trust is our currency. Earn it daily, protect it fiercely, and let it fuel what’s next.
  • Take ownership: Bold choices with integrity at the core—that’s how impact lasts.
  • Be humble: Humility opens the door to better ideas. Hear others, lift others, keep learning.

Crescendo is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We value diversity, inclusion, equity, and belonging and these pillars are at the heart of how we work together. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, Veteran status, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

We are committed to the inclusion of all individuals and will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in our job application process. If you require assistance or accommodations to participate in the job application or interview process, please contact careers@crescendo.ai.

PRIVACY NOTICE

Crescendo is committed to ensuring your privacy and the protection of your personal data. By filling out the forms associated with your job application and submitting your data to us, you are giving us your consent to process your data and store it for potential recruitment and hiring purposes.

To understand more about Crescendo’s privacy program, including your rights and options for managing the personal data you submit to us, please visit our Privacy Center here.

title: Quality Engineer
description:
This role offers an exciting opportunity to contribute to the advancement of AI-driven solutions by focusing on quality assurance in low-code/no-code environments. As a Quality Engineer, you will play a key role in testing and validating AI solutions built using platforms like Microsoft Copilot, Power Platform and intelligent automation tools. You will help ensure that these intelligent systems meet high standards of reliability, usability, and performance. This position supports our mission to deliver innovative, scalable, and trustworthy AI solutions to our clients.

Position Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and execute automated and manual test cases for low code/no code AI solutions and other intelligent automation tools .
  • Collaborates closely with cross-functional teams including developers, business analysts, and product managers to identify and resolve quality issues.
  • Perform functional, regression, and exploratory testing on related technologies.
  • Identify, analyze, and track defects using standard QA tools.
  • Conducts code reviews, identifies potential areas of risk, and proposes solutions to mitigate quality related issues.
  • Captures, records, and implements leading practices for continuous learning and improvement.
  • Amendable to working in QC (hybrid setup) and on a mid-shift schedule (or as required by the business)

Required Qualifications:

  • 2-4 years of experience in software testing or quality engineering.
  • 1+ years of experience testing applications built on Microsoft Power Platform or similar low-code/no-code tools.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
  • Familiarity with AI/ML concepts and testing strategies for intelligent systems.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with Microsoft Copilot, Power Platform and other similar low-code/no-code tools testing.
  • Knowledge of test automation frameworks and scripting.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent communication and documentation abilities.
  • ISTQB or equivalent certification.

title: Database Support - Hybrid
description:

  • Bachelor of Master’s Degree in Computer Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science or related field
  • At least 5 years’ experience in IS support and maintenance, Business Analysis maintenance, System analysis or related fields.

Job Description

DEO – Digital External Offering – and GDP (Global Digital Platform) are worldwide platforms proposed to ESSILOR laboratories as well as our internal laboratories, allowing the remote calculation for lens products and production processes. Those applications provide services to more than 450 customers with a growth estimation to double our volume in the next months that requires setting up new calculation (*) environments regularly. This activity includes creating new connections path for security accesses, setting up products databases, adapting statistics tools and ensuring good response time performance for the service delivered.

The Calculation Application Support Engineer will report to the Rx IT Calculation Support Manager based in Lat Krabang, operating under his leadership for the day-to-day operational activities. The team is split between Bangkok and Manila in the Philippines.

Management team of the project is located in France and the support engineer will often be in contact with them.

Software enhancements are not under the Thailand team responsibilities, but into another ESSILOR’s department based in India.

Roles & Responsibilities:

Technical & Functional Support for Calculation Systems (software) (Level 3 ITIL)

  • Clients assistance and support on Calculation Systems
  • Define solutions to resolve user problems and improve global efficiency.
  • Use current ITIL process within ESSILOR IT Department to manage support activities.
  • Continuous improvement to maintain performance and high availability of calculation solutions.

Implementation / Deployment

  • Performing pre-production setup and successful integration as well as Non Regression Testing prior to implementing in production.
  • Providing client assistance and support for upgrade or new implementations calculation software.
  • Deploying new customer environments with implementation of Calculation System as well as providing Calculation support for all customers worldwide.
  • Conducting User Training for new Services / Evolution in Asia as requested by customers.
  • Improve daily operations of support activities by developing appropriate tools or scripts.

Projects

  • Projects participation in the development of New Digital Services as required.
  • Evaluate system specifications to improve calculation software maintenance.
  • Direct contact with Digital Services team in France (support and development team) / India or Philippines

Calculation teams of ESSILOR Partners as well as Global Engineering teams. IT Infrastructure team (Lat Krabang and France). Teams for the Calculation support level 1 and level 2 (Lat Krabang and France) based on the ITIL definition. Database Administrators in Lat Krabang

title: Senior Delivery Consultant - Cloud Application, Professional Services
description:
DESCRIPTION

A Delivery Consultant (DC) in ProServe is a technical expert who works directly with customers to implement and manage cloud solutions that align with their business objectives. This role combines deep technical knowledge of AWS services with strong consulting skills to ensure successful project delivery and customer satisfaction.

A Delivery Consultant works closely with customers to understand their technical requirements and business objectives, and how those objectives can be met through their cloud journey. Delivery Consultants are responsible for designing, implementing, and managing AWS solutions, providing technical guidance and best practices, troubleshooting issues, and ensuring successful project delivery. Delivery Consultants collaborate cross-functionally and leverage their expertise in cloud technologies to drive their customers success.

Delivery Consultants have a deep understanding of AWS products and services, including compute, storage, networking, security, databases, machine learning, and serverless technologies. Delivery Consultants are proficient in delivering complex, scalable, and secure solutions tailored to meet the specific needs of each customer. Delivery Consultants work closely with stakeholders to gather requirements, assess current infrastructure, and propose effective migration strategies to AWS. They are responsible for leading the implementation process, ensuring adherence to best practices, optimizing performance, and managing risks throughout the project. Delivery Consultants are often trusted advisors to our customers, providing guidance on industry trends, emerging technologies, and innovative solutions to address customer challenges. They share knowledge within the organization, through mentoring, training, creation of reusable artifacts and process improvements.

About the team
Diverse Experiences
Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.

Why AWS
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.

Work/Life Balance
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.

Inclusive Team Culture
AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.

Mentorship and Career Growth
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

  • 5+ year of experience in cloud architecture and implementation.
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, related field, or equivalent experience
  • Strong full-stack application development experience with 1 or more of the following programming languages: Java/Spring/boot, Angular/ReactJS, Golang, dotnet
- experience with streaming, event-driven platform - Kafka, Kinesis and knowledge of REST/JSON, GraphQL
  • Experience with API/Integration platforms such as API-Gateway, Mulesoft, Kong, etc

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • AWS experience preferred, with proficiency in a wide range of AWS services (e.g., EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, IAM, VPC, Terraform)
  • AWS experience in Containers (EKS or ECS), Microservices
  • full-stack development experience
  • AWS Professional level certifications (e.g., Solutions Architect Professional, DevOps Engineer Professional) preferred
  • Experience with automation and scripting (e.g., Terraform, Python)
  • Knowledge of security and compliance standards (e.g., HIPAA, GDPR)
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

title: Senior Professional Services Engineer, CX
description:
At NiCE, we don't limit our challenges. We challenge our limits. Always. We're ambitious. We're game changers. And we play to win. We set the highest standards and execute beyond them. And if you're like us, we can offer you the ultimate career opportunity that will light a fire within you.

MPower Proactive AI Agents has recently become a part of the NICE CXOne suite and is a market leader in proactive conversational AI.


MPower Proactive AI Agents is a cloud-hosted conversation platform. Proactive and omni-channel, MPower Proactive AI Agents leverages artificial intelligence, natural language understanding and machine learning so that global brands can transform their customer journeys. MPower Proactive AI Agents disrupts the traditional call-centres; just a fraction of the cost to deploy and run, but with three times the customer engagement rate of its manual call-centre predecessors. This means that as well as being lower cost, MPower Proactive AI Agents can drive corporate KPIs harder and faster, at the same time as improving the customer experience.

More about the role…

As a rapidly growing business, we are further expanding the team here in Manila. In this new role, you will become a MPower Proactive AI Agents expert and advocate, delivering high-quality implementations, analysis, support, and much more to clients across the globe.

Working initially with both the EU and US teams you will provide implementation and support to our new and existing clients, then when MPower Proactive AI Agents expands into APAC, the Manila team will also lead the implementation, quality assurance, support, and delivery for local clients.

Key Responsibilities…

  • Become a subject matter expert in the MPower Proactive AI Agents solution, such as, but not limited to, data model, reporting structure, and AI-driven functionalities.
  • Design, develop, and maintain reports, dashboards, and analytics tools that provide business-critical insights to internal stakeholders and external customers.
  • Train team members, partners, and clients on the available data structures and reporting tools.
  • Conduct research and perform data analysis to identify root causes of issues, assess impact, and uncover anomalies or inconsistencies within the data.
  • Collaborate with global cross-functional teams to analyze customer journeys, identify trends, and produce insightful reports and dashboards.
  • Learn and continuously adapt to modern technologies, such as, but not limited to, AI-enabled data management and automation tools.
  • Participate in and lead the definition and implementation of optimization strategies, leveraging deep insights from data.
  • Support data governance efforts by documenting processes, maintaining a knowledge base, and contributing to data security best practices.
  • Understand, propose, improve, implement processes (what processes? Very vague)
  • Write efficient and optimized SQL and scripts to extract, transform, analyze, and present data in meaningful formats.
  • Contribute to building and evolving data standards, best practices, and scalable solutions for reporting and analytics.
  • Take initiative in proposing and experimenting with new tools, architectures, and methodologies for data storage, processing, and visualization.
  • Provide on-call support to global customers
  • And other responsibilities

Knowledge/Experience…

Basic Qualifications:

  • 6+ years experience in a consulting / data engineering / professional services role
  • 3+ years experience in senior/leadership roles
  • Ability to influence stakeholders and customers on project management and related topics.
  • Experience working with databases (relational and non-relational) at scale (ex: MySQL, Redshift, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis, Cassandra, etc.)
  • Experience working with data warehouses and data lakes, including the associated ETL, reporting and data visualization tools (example: Looker, Power BI, Tableau, etc.)
  • Experience writing complex queries (SQL/NoSQL)
  • Expertise, knowledge, and understanding of architectures needed to build business-centric reports from multiple data sources (ranging from basic to complex)
  • Expert understanding of Professional Services Project Management Policies and Processes
  • Develop processes and process improvements to ensure high-quality and cost effectiveness
  • Excel in the ability to identify areas of concern based on documentation based on product knowledge, the needs of the stakeholders/customer, and other factors
  • Analytical mindset with excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
  • Willingness and enthusiasm to learn complex AI-driven platforms and tools.
  • Ability to successfully work in a team-oriented, highly collaborative environment
  • Ability to clearly communicate and present to stakeholders (internal and external)
  • Amenable to work shifting schedules

Nice to Have:

  • Familiarity with AI/ML-driven data solutions, or interest in learning.
  • Experience working in cloud environments (Example: Azure, AWS, or GCP).
  • Exposure to Python, R, or other scripting languages for data analysis.
  • Understanding of data privacy, security, and governance frameworks.

About NiCE

NICE Ltd. (NASDAQ: NICE) software products are used by 25,000+ global businesses, including 85 of the Fortune 100 corporations, to deliver extraordinary customer experiences, fight financial crime and ensure public safety. Every day, NiCE software manages more than 120 million customer interactions and monitors 3+ billion financial transactions.

Known as an innovation powerhouse that excels in AI, cloud and digital, NiCE is consistently recognized as the market leader in its domains, with over 8,500 employees across 30+ countries.

NiCE is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, neurotype, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other category protected by law.

title: Senior Data Scientist (R Expert)
description:
Founded in 1994 and headquartered in Switzerland, ERNI is a leading Software Development company with over 800 employees worldwide. Specializing in IT and software engineering, we drive innovation in process and technology. Our first service center in Asia Pacific, located in Metro Manila (Mandaluyong), supports clients across Europe, APAC, the Philippines, and the USA. As we continue to grow, we're looking for passionate and motivated individuals to join our team.

Why ERNI is the Perfect Place for You:

  • International Exposure: Work with global clients on cutting-edge projects.
  • Inclusive Culture: Thrive in a collaborative and diverse work environment.
  • Career Development: Enjoy continuous learning and professional growth opportunities.

Perks and Benefits:
  • Career Stability: Enjoy a stable career path with ample project opportunities.
  • Immediate Coverage: Private HMO and insurance benefits from day one.
  • Jubilee Celebration: A 5-year milestone includes a complimentary trip to any European ERNI sites.
  • Comprehensive Benefits: Government-mandated benefits including 13th-month pay.
  • Skill Enhancement: Access free training and certifications.
  • Baby Basket: To welcome your newborn to the ERNI family.
  • Fruit Basket: Boost of vitamins during hospitalization.
  • Office Perks: Enjoy free snacks and coffee.

Growth and Opportunities:
  • Free Training: Advance your skills through technical and non-technical training.
  • Challenging Projects: Engage in complex software projects across MedTech, Industry,
Finance, and Transportation.
  • Supportive Environment: Benefit from a team dedicated to guiding and supporting your success.
  • Recognition and Advancement: Receive acknowledgment for your efforts and
opportunities for promotion.
  • Open Communication: Experience transparency and value your input in our culture.

Flexibility:
  • Hybrid Work Setup: Balance remote and in-person work for better work-life integration.

Events:
  • Connect and Celebrate: Participate in a variety of events including leisure, summer,
family, social, and year-end gatherings.

What are our wishes:
  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, or related discipline.
  • 3+ years of experience in data science, analytics, or data engineering, with hands-on coding in R and Python.
  • Proven experience migrating analytical pipelines from R to Python in production or enterprise environments.
  • Strong working knowledge of Databricks, including PySpark, Delta Lake, Databricks Jobs, and Workspace management.
  • Understanding of data modeling, feature engineering, and ETL/ELT design patterns.
  • Proficiency with Git, notebook versioning, and collaborative development workflows.
  • Strong grasp of statistical methods, ML modeling, and validation frameworks.
  • Preferred:
  • Experience deploying pipelines in Azure Databricks, AWS Databricks, or GCP Databricks environments.
  • Familiarity with Airflow, Azure Data Factory, or Databricks Workflows for orchestration.
  • Exposure to MLOps practices and model lifecycle management within Databricks.
  • Understanding of cost optimization, cluster configuration, and data governance on cloud platforms.
  • Experience writing SQL and working with large-scale datasets.


Soft Skills

  • Analytical mindset with strong attention to detail and validation discipline.
  • Clear communicator — able to explain data migration rationale, architecture trade-offs, and results to technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Proactive, self-driven, and comfortable in a fast-evolving cloud and data ecosystem.
  • Collaborative team player who thrives in cross-functional environments spanning data science, engineering, and business teams.

How can you contribute to the team?


About the Role

  • We are looking for a Data Scientist with strong expertise in R, Python, and Databricks to lead the modernization of our analytical ecosystem.
    In this role, you will be responsible for translating and rebuilding existing R-based data pipelines, models, and analytical workflows into Python, optimized for execution within the Databricks Lakehouse Platform.
  • You will play a key role in ensuring that the migration enhances scalability, maintainability, and performance while preserving analytical accuracy and business value.

Key Responsibilities

  • Analyze, document, and deconstruct existing R-based data pipelines, scripts, and models used for analytics or reporting.
  • Rebuild, refactor, and optimize those workflows in Python using Databricks notebooks and clusters.
  • Leverage PySpark to handle large-scale data transformations, aggregations, and modeling at scale.
  • Collaborate with data engineers to integrate migrated pipelines into the broader data lakehouse architecture (Delta Lake).
  • Ensure parity between legacy R outputs and new Python/Databricks workflows through rigorous validation and testing.
  • Use Databricks Jobs, Workflows, and Delta Live Tables to automate and orchestrate data pipelines.
  • Implement software engineering best practices — version control (Git), unit testing, CI/CD, and documentation.
  • Collaborate with business analysts and domain experts to ensure model interpretability and continuity of business insights.
  • Support data governance, quality, and reproducibility by building clean, modular, and auditable codebases.
  • Contribute to the standardization of Python libraries, Databricks templates, and reusable components across teams.
